bug.author: sherifshehata
bug.summary: Feature request: no validation datasets, sharing validation set
bug.description: Hello, I would suggest that you redesign the handling of training and validation sets. In some cases a user may need to do training only without validation (maybe because the user merged validation and training sets for generating a final model, or to do faster training). Additionally sometimes the user could use a shared validation set across different versions of training sets, which would lead to data duplication in the current setup. Thanks you.

comments.comment: Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/sherifshehata>@sherifshehata</denchmark-link> are you referring to the Object Detection workflow?
Yes. Sorry i didn't specify that in the original description.

The original intention was to make the validation set optional in the object detection work-flow. Obviously now if you leave the corresponding fields blank in the form you get an error. Digging into this a bit more it looks like <denchmark-link:https://github.com/NVIDIA/DIGITS/blob/v4.0.0/digits/utils/forms.py#L51>validate_required_if_set</denchmark-link> is not behaving as intended because of this test: if other_field_value is not None and other_field_value is not "": In our case if we leave the field blank the value of the field is u'' and: >>> u'' is not '' True I don't know if it's a regression (I think I tested it!) but it looks to me like we could replace the condition with: if other_field_value: As it seems to do what we want: >>> bool(None) False >>> bool(u'') False >>> bool('') False I have tentatively pushed <denchmark-link:https://github.com/NVIDIA/DIGITS/pull/1105>#1105</denchmark-link> if you wish to try. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/lukeyeager>@lukeyeager</denchmark-link> any idea on this?
I think this will solve it. Thank you.
